glsa.title: Postfix: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Postfix may allow local users to gain root privileges.

background.p: Postfix is a mail server and an alternative to the widely-used Sendmail program.

description.p: By default, Berkeley DB reads a DB_CONFIG configuration file from the current working directory. This is an undocumented behavior.

impact.p: A local attacker, by using a specially crafted DG_CONFIG file, could possibly escalate privileges to the root group.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Postfix users should upgrade to the latest version:
